questions.question: 2- Which of the following is the correct way to create a component in React?
3- What is the purpose of keys in React lists?
options: B) To uniquely identify each element in the list
C) To track changes in the list

questions.question: 4- In React, what is used to pass data to a component from outside?
5- Which lifecycle method is called when a component is being removed from the DOM?
6- What does the useState hook do in a functional component?
options: A) Connects the component to a Redux store
B) Adds local state to the component
C) Fetches data from an API
D) Manages the components lifecycle events
questions.correctAnswer: B) Adds local state to the component

questions.question: 7- In React, what is a higher-order component (HOC)?
options: A) A component that renders other components
B) A function that takes a component and returns a new component
C) A class that inherits from another class component
D) A component that passes props to its children
questions.correctAnswer: B) A function that takes a component and returns a new component

questions.question: 8- How do you access a function fetch() from a <CustomButton /> component in its parent component?
options: D) By using the context API

questions.question: 9- Which hook is used in functional React components to perform side effects?
10- How can you prevent a component from rendering in React?
options: A) Return false from the render method
B) Return null from the render method
C) Set the state to null
D) Use the shouldComponentUpdate lifecycle method
questions.correctAnswer: B) Return null from the render method
